New Records: Herro extended his streak of double-figure games to 61
Herro broke the Heat’s previous record set by Tim Hardaway for scoring three-pointers
Adebayo reached a personal milestone with his 8,000th career point
Key Match Events: Ware demonstrated his offensive threat with an alley-oop and an early three-pointer
Missi entered the match with considerable hype but it was Ware who capitalized on the opportunity
Butler, who had recently recovered from illness, and Robinson, returning from a strained foot, started alongside Adebayo, Tyler Herro, and Haywood Highsmith
Despite challenges, the team managed to prevail with a 119-108 victory
Herro extended his streak of double-figure games to 61 and broke the Heat’s previous record set by Tim Hardaway for scoring three-pointers
Pre-Game Insights: Spoelstra emphasized the importance of consistency and momentum
The Pelicans began the game with Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, Herb Jones, Trey Murphy, and Missi
Adebayo reached a personal milestone with his 8,000th career point
The team faced sanctions earlier, with Terry Rozier suspended and Herro fined for an altercation in Houston
Post-Match Reflections: Spoelstra expressed his trust in Butler’s readiness
The reunion of former teammates Corey Brewer, Butler, and Highsmith added a personal touch to the evening
The Miami Heat’s victory over the Pelicans not only highlighted Kel’el Ware’s emerging talent but also underscored the team’s resilience and focus on consistency
With key players returning and new milestones achieved, the Heat are poised to build on this momentum in upcoming games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game at Kaseya Center saw two promising rookies face off: Kel’el Ware of the Miami Heat and Yves Missi from the Pelicans
The Miami Heat managed their seventh back-to-back set this season
The team looked to maintain their winning momentum, having previously succeeded at home against the Suns and Cavaliers
